page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN ALVA
page.content: For many years Alva's main{industry used to be weaving. The sheep grazing on the hills provided wool,and the swift flowing burns meant that there was power for the mills,where blankets and shawls were made. There are still mills in Alva today. Berryfield knitwear specialises in mohair. Inverallan knitters has arans and icelandics. Glentana does mohair and cashmere. Some mills like Dolf Textiles have gone over to production work for other firms. Coblecrook Dyeworks also connected with the {woollen trade,}gives jobs to local people as well. Coblecrook gets its name from "Cobalt Creek."{Cobalt}used to be mined in the hills above Alva.
